Welcome to Proposal of ReconGraph structure!¶

Examples¶

Creating the data structure:

# Old dictionary structure
old_recon_graph = {
    ('n0', 'm2'): [('S', ('n2', 'm3'), ('n1', 'm4'))],
    ('n1', 'm4'): [('C', (None, None), (None, None))],
    ('n2', 'm3'): [('T', ('n3', 'm3'), ('n4', 'm1'))],
    ('n3', 'm3'): [('C', (None, None), (None, None))],
    ('n4', 'm1'): [('C', (None, None), (None, None))],
}

# New ReconGraph structure
source = MappingNode('n0', 'm2')
recongraph = ReconGraph(sources=[source])
recongraph.add_event(MappingNode('n0', 'm2'), Cospeciation(MappingNode('n2', 'm3'), MappingNode('n1', 'm4')))
recongraph.add_event(MappingNode('n1', 'm4'), TipTip())
recongraph.add_event(MappingNode('n2', 'm3'), Transfer(MappingNode('n3', 'm3'), MappingNode('n4', 'm1')))
recongraph.add_event(MappingNode('n3', 'm3'), TipTip())
recongraph.add_event(MappingNode('n4', 'm1'), TipTip())

# New (single) Reconciliation structure
source = MappingNode('n0', 'm2')
recon = Reconciliation(source)
recon.set_event(MappingNode('n0', 'm2'), Cospeciation(MappingNode('n2', 'm3'), MappingNode('n1', 'm4')))
recon.set_event(MappingNode('n1', 'm4'), TipTip())
recon.set_event(MappingNode('n2', 'm3'), Transfer(MappingNode('n3', 'm3'), MappingNode('n4', 'm1')))
recon.set_event(MappingNode('n3', 'm3'), TipTip())
recon.set_event(MappingNode('n4', 'm1'), TipTip())

Checking whether the mapping ('n1', 'm4') has a cospeciation event:

# Old dictionary structure
has_cospeciation = False
mapping = ('n0', 'm2')
for event in old_recon_graph[mapping]:
    if event[0] == 'S':
        has_cospeciation = True
        break

# New ReconGraph structure
has_cospeciation = False
mapping = MappingNode('n0', 'm2')
for event in recongraph.events_of(mapping):
    if event.event_type is EventType.COSPECIATION:
        has_cospeciation = True
        break

# New (single) Reconciliation structure
is_cospeciation = recon.event_of(MappingNode('n0', 'm2')).event_type is EventType.COSPECIATION

Getting the source mapping node:

# Old dictionary structure requires passing the source mapping node around

# New ReconGraph structure
sources = recongraph.sources

# New (single) Reconciliation structure
source = recon.source

Checking whether ('n4', 'm1') is a sink:

# Old dictionary structure
mapping_is_sink = old_recon_graph[('n4', 'm1')][0][0] == 'C'

# New ReconGraph structure
mapping_is_sink = recongraph.is_sink(MappingNode('n4', 'm1'))

# New (single) Reconciliation structure
mapping_is_sink = recon.is_sink(MappingNode('n4', 'm1'))

Documentation¶

Note that property p of a class C means you can access it with C.p without parenthesis

A Proposal for reconciliation graph and reconciliation interface.

class MappingNode(parasite_vertex: str, host_vertex: str)¶

MappingNode is a node in the reconciliation graph that maps a parasite to a host.

property host¶
property parasite¶
class EventType¶

EventType is the type of event node.

COSPECIATION = 1¶
DUPLICATION = 2¶
LOSS = 4¶
TIPTIP = 5¶
TRANSFER = 3¶
class Event(freq: float = None)¶

Base Class for events.

property event_type¶

Returns the event type of this event.

property freq¶
class Cospeciation(left: recon.MappingNode, right: recon.MappingNode, freq=None)¶

Cospeciation is an event where two children of the parasite vertex maps to the two children of the host vertex. Cospeciation event has two child MappingNode named left and right.

property event_type¶

Returns the event type of this event.

property freq¶
property left¶
property right¶
class Duplication(left: recon.MappingNode, right: recon.MappingNode, freq=None)¶

Duplication is an event where two children of the parasite vertex maps to the same host vertex as their parent. Cospeciation event has two child MappingNode named left and right.

property event_type¶

Returns the event type of this event.

property freq¶
property left¶
property right¶
class Transfer(left: recon.MappingNode, right: recon.MappingNode, freq=None)¶

Transfer is an event where one child of the parasite vertex maps to the same host vertex as its parent, while the other child maps to a host vertex not ancestrally related to the first one. Transfer event has two child MappingNode named left and right. The right child is always the child that gets transferred.

property event_type¶

Returns the event type of this event.

property freq¶
property left¶
property right¶
class Loss(child: recon.MappingNode, freq=None)¶

Loss is an event where the parasite vertex goes down to only one of the lineage of the host vertex when the host vertex speciates. Loss event has one child MappingNode called child. The parasite of the child MappingNode (self.child.parasite) is the same as the parasite of the MappingNode that incurs the lost.

property child¶
property event_type¶

Returns the event type of this event.

property freq¶
class TipTip(freq: float = None)¶

TipTip (tip mapping) is an event where both the parasite and the host are leaves. Biologically, this means the parasite and the host lives together at present time. The TipTip event is the sink of the reconciliation graph and has no children.

property event_type¶

Returns the event type of this event.

property freq¶
class Reconciliation(source: recon.MappingNode, initial_map: Dict[recon.MappingNode, recon.Event] = {})¶

Reconciliation is a tree that represents an edge-to-edge mapping from a parasite tree to a host tree. The Reconciliation starts with source MappingNode where the parasite first enters the host. Each MappingNode has one corresponding Event. Each event has up to two children MappingNode depending on its type. The leaves of the tree are the TipTip events which have no children MappingNode.

event_of(mapping: recon.MappingNode) → recon.Event¶

Get the event corresponding to mapping.

is_sink(mapping: recon.MappingNode) → bool¶

Whether the host and the parasite of the mapping are leaves of its phylogenic tree with a tip mapping.

static load(path) → recon.Reconciliation¶

Load a Reconciliation from path, e.g. Reconciliation.load('./reconname').

mapping_of(parasite: str) → recon.MappingNode¶

Returns the MappingNode of the parasite vertex. This is where that parasite vertex maps to. Never returns a mapping node that corresponds to a loss event.

save(path: str, metadata: Dict[str, str] = {})¶

Save the Reconciliation to path, e.g. recon.save('./reconname') This will save the Reconciliation along with the metadata if metadata is specified, e.g. recon.save('./reconname', {'created_at': 'Noon'}). The metadata is only for book-keeping purposes and is not read when load.

set_event(mapping: recon.MappingNode, event: recon.Event)¶

Set the event corresponding to mapping.

class ReconGraph(sources: List[recon.MappingNode], initial_map: Dict[recon.MappingNode, List[recon.Event]] = {})¶

ReconGraph is a directed acyclic graph that compactlyrepresent multiple Reconciliations. The Reconciliation starts with a list of source MappingNode where the parasite first enters the host. Each MappingNode has a list of corresponding Event. Each event has up to two children MappingNode depending on its type. The sinks of this graph are the TipTip events which have no children MappingNode.

add_event(mapping: recon.MappingNode, event: recon.Event)¶

Add an event corresponding to mapping.

enumerate() → List[recon.Reconciliation]¶

Returns all Reconciliation represented in this ReconGraph.

events_of(mapping: recon.MappingNode) → List[recon.Event]¶

Get a list of events corresponding to mapping.

is_sink(mapping: recon.MappingNode) → bool¶

Whether the host and the parasite of the mapping are leaves of its phylogenic tree with a tip mapping.

static load(path) → recon.ReconGraph¶

Load a Reconciliation from path, e.g. Reconciliation.load('./reconname').

save(path: str, metadata: Dict[str, str] = {})¶

Save the ReconGraph to path, e.g. recon.save('./reconname') This will save the reconciliation graph along with the metadata if metadata is specified, e.g. recon.save('./reconname', {'created_at': 'Noon'}). The metadata is only for book-keeping purposes and is not read when load.

set_events(mapping: recon.MappingNode, events: List[recon.Event])¶

Set a mapping to correspond to a list of events.

reconmap-proposal
